name: econml
description: This package contains several methods for calculating Conditional Average Treatment Effects

repo.name: EconML
repo.description: ALICE (Automated Learning and Intelligence for Causation and Economics) is a Microsoft Research project aimed at applying Artificial Intelligence concepts to economic decision making. One of its  goals is to build a toolkit that combines state-of-the-art machine learning techniques with econometrics in order to bring automation to complex causal inference problems. To date, the ALICE Python SDK (econml) implements orthogonal machine learning algorithms such as the double machine learning work of Chernozhukov et al. This toolkit is designed to measure the causal effect of some treatment variable(s) t on an outcome variable y, controlling for a set of features x.

readme.summary: Strong conceptual overview with excellent clarity about purpose, but README is cut off mid-sentence before reaching critical installation/usage sections.
readme.top_issue: README content is truncated before the Installation section completes, making it impossible to evaluate the actual installation instructions, usage examples, or other practical guidance that appears to exist based on the table of contents

common_complaints: Model serialization/pickle compatibility issues across environments
Documentation gaps and unclear API semantics (W vs X parameters, cate_intercept interpretation)
Missing features for classification workflows (predict_proba not used in MetaLearners)
Dependency and build issues (numpy 2.0 support, Databricks installation failures)
Parameter passing inconsistencies (n_jobs not propagated to auto learners)
sentiment.summary: EconML shows signs of maintenance slowdown with multiple unresolved feature requests, compatibility issues, and documentation gaps accumulating over recent months without maintainer responses, though the project appears technically functional for active users.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent
407 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
No merged or open pull requests in past 6 months
High issue backlog indicates unaddressed maintenance needs
positive_signals: Recent commit activity on 2026-01-12 suggests some minimal activity
maintenance.summary: Package appears abandoned with large unaddressed issue backlog and no maintenance activity or releases in the past 6 months.
